speaker: Arena Grounds
lines: Canvas banners slap the wind; sand in the seams tastes like old thunder.
Vendors shout the same three prices until they sound like a prayer.
The pit's lip is chewed by a thousand boots and twice as many hopes.
A bell hangs from a beam; it rings when it likes you and when it doesn't.
A board lists today's roster; chalk dust turns champions into rumors.
Men and women wrap hands in linen and intention.
A promoter smiles like a locked door; a medic frowns like the key.
The crowd is already a storm. Someone decides you'll be lightning.
